client_profile: Couple looking to buy an apartment in Brussels, budget 490,000–895,000 EUR. Priorities include cafes & brunch, restaurants, expats & international networks, with access to the EU quarter.
must_have: Access to cafes and brunch spots
red_flags: Potential high costs near EU quarter
Limited parking options in busy areas
contradictions: Budget constraints vs. high demand neighborhoods
Desire for quiet areas vs. vibrant cafe culture
Proximity to work vs. spacious living

top_districts.name: Etterbeek
why: Easy access to cafes at Jourdan and green spaces in Cinquantenaire.
Strong public transport connections via metro and bus lines.
watch_out: Rents near EU quarter can be higher.

top_districts.name: Ixelles
why: Vibrant brunch scene around Flagey and great restaurants on Châtelain.
Good connections to public transport and central Brussels.
watch_out: Popular streets get noisy on weekends.

top_districts.name: Saint-Josse-ten-Noode
why: Close to nightlife options and restaurants along Botanique edge.
Strategic location with access to metro and tram lines.
watch_out: Dense and busy; pick well-connected streets.
